description: Middle English lothe, from Old English lāþian, from Proto-West Germanic *laiþēn, from Proto-Germanic *laiþāną. Cognate with Old Norse leiðask ( > Danish ledes, Icelandic leiðast, all reflexive), German Leid.

verbs.description: loathe (third-person singular simple present loathes, present participle loathing, simple past and past participle loathed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To detest, hate, or revile (someone or something).
